page.title: 08SCHOOL CROSSING WARDEN
page.content:
A school crossing warden's job is to see children safely across busy roads. When it is safe they go onto the road and hold up a stick with a round circle on top. It says STOP children. It looks like a big lollipop so they are called lollipop men or ladies. They wear a bright coloured yellow or white uniform so that drivers can see them better.
Recently in our local paper, the Telford Journal, our warden has been complaining about the cars going too fast near St. Georges Primary School. She wrote to our M.P.. She was having nightmares about a child getting knocked over. Nothing has been done so she has left. No one has taken the job so we are without a warden.
